PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIAN, JAPANESE AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: Amcor (AMC AT) is expected to sign USD 7bln bid for BEMIS this week
content:
AUSTRALIA

Amcor (AMC AT)

AUSTRALIA

Amcor (AMC AT)
- Co. is expected to sign USD 7bln bid for BEMIS this week. (Newswires)

BHP (BHP AT)
- Co. is said to be willing to go into mediated discussions with Escondida mine workers union. (Newswires)

Crowne Resorts (CWN AT)
- Victoria state gambling commission said the Co. remains suitable to continue holding its Melbourne casino licence in its review. (Newswires)

Downer EDI (DOW AT)
- Co. receives USD 120mln 3yr contract related to the CSA mine. (Newswires)

Karoon Gas (KAR AT)
- Co. is planning to submit bid for the Bauna oil fields after Petrobras resumed the sale process. (AFR)

Financials
- Australia’s superannuation fund industry is to face a grilling when the royal commission resumes its enquiry today. (SMH)

Energy
- China tariff threat of 25% on LNG from US could benefit Australia’s LNG industry. (AFR)
- WTI crude fell 0.4%.


 

JAPAN

Isuzu Motors (7202 JT)
- Co. Q1 net JPY 38.1bln vs. Prev., JPY 32.8bln Y/Y, rev. JPY 488.1bln vs. Prev. JPY 463.9bln Y/Y. (Newswires)
- Co. and Toyota (7203 JT) announced to end their capital tie-up in which Isuzu will buy back all of Toyota's 5.89% stake for JPY 80bln. (Nikkei)

JX Holdings (5020 JT)
- Co. Q1 oper. profit is seen at JPY 200bln. (Newswires)

Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (9432 JT)
- Co. raises stake in Indonesia’s Bank Danamon. (Newswires)

Nissan Motor (7201 JT)
- Co. agrees to offload its battery unit to Envision Group in which it will retain 25% interest in the new entity. (Newswires)

NTT (9432 JT)
- Co. is planning a reorganization which will combine its communication and data units into an IT giant to compete with the likes of IBM and Google. (Nikkei)

Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group (8316 JT)
- Co. Q1 net JPY 227.1bln vs. Prev. JPY 241.5bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Yamato Holdings (9064 JT)
- Japanese authorities are to conduct an inspection on Co. offices due to overcharging allegations. (Newswires)


 

SOUTH KOREA

Korean Air (003490 KS)
- South Korea and Singapore reached a deal to expand bilateral flights in which airlines will be permitted to operate as much as 14 flights per week from Busan. (Newswires)

Kumho Petrochemical (005930 KS)
- Co. Q2 net KRW 175.3bln vs. Exp. KRW 106.8bln. (Newswires)

Samsung Electronics (005930 KS)
- Co. shipments to Apple (AAPL) reportedly declined sharply during Q2 in which its shipped 6mln OLED products to the US tech giant vs. Prev. 20mln Q/Q. (Newswires)
- Co. reportedly to postpone investment plan announcement. (Newswires)

- South Korean President Moon Jae-in is said to be beginning to discuss regarding the possibility of a scaled-back US military presence in the peninsula. (Nikkei)

subject: UK Treasury reportedly has asked for help regarding Brexit action plan, according to reports
PBoC begins fine tuning of macro economic policies, according to reports in China Daily
OCBC (OCBS SP) Q2 net SGD 1.2bln vs. Exp. SGD 1.1bln, NII rose 8% to SGD 1.45bln vs. Prev. SGD 1.35bln Y/Y
UK PM May is said to be confident of reaching a Brexit agreement according to sources who insist there is only a very small probability of failing to reach an agreement with the EU
ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights Include Australian MI Inflation Gauge and New Zealand Commodity Prices
Reports state that Saudi Foreign Affairs Ministry recalls its Ambassador to Canada and considers Canadian Ambassador persona non grata
Saudi Arabia is said to have frozen all trade investment with Canada and noted that that the Canadian envoy in Riyadh is unwelcome
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
ASIA

PBoC raised the reserve requirement on FX forwards trading to 20%, while it stated it will take counter cyclical measures to keep FX markets stable based on market condition and that it will also keep the yuan "basically stable". (Newswires)
Note: The PBoC had previously cut the reserve requirement on FX forwards to 0% from 20% in September last year which some suggested was an effort to stem the yuan's appreciation, while today's announcement restores it back to that level.

China released their potential retaliation list to US tariff threats on Friday and are to impose differentiated tariffs on approximately USD 60bln US goods. China said the measures are to guard its interest and to keep trade frictions from escalating and that import tax rates will range from 5%, 10% and 25%. Furthermore, China stated the government reserve the right for additional retaliation measures, while the proposed retaliatory tariff list by China includes some US aircraft, chemical products, wine, semiconductors, auto parts, lumber, iron ore, steel products, dried beef and soybean oil. (Newswires)

China state media commentary stated that US administration’s extreme pressure and blackmail are clear to the world but added that these methods will not be fruitful against China. (Xinhua)

White House spokesperson said on Friday that the US has had a high level of discussions with China on trade over the past few months and noted they are open to having further conversations. However, there were also comments from a senior US administration official that there has been zero engagement between US president Trump & China, apart from one call in the last few days which resolved nothing. (Newswires)


UK

UK Trade Secretary Fox said the likelihood of a no-deal Brexit is increasing in which he blamed the "intransigence" of the European Commission. Fox also placed the chances of leaving the EU without a deal at "60-40" and stated that EU Chief Negotiator Barnier dismissed the UK's Chequers proposals simply because "we have never done it before". This also comes alongside commentary in the Sunday Times over the weekend that businesses and investors are scrambling to protect themselves against a plunge in the value of the pound if Britain crashes out of the EU in March. (BBC/Sunday Times)

UK Chancellor Hammond alleged that France was attempting to stall UK access to the EU post-Brexit. (FT)
 

EU

ECB's Lautenschlaeger stated it would be wrong for the central bank to abruptly change monetary policy direction which would not help the economy nor price stability. Lautenschlaeger also stated she is very much in favour of normalizing monetary policy which means gradually raising interest rates and that the pre-condition is that the path to price stability is sustainably strengthened. (Newswires)

Fitch affirmed Germany at AAA; Outlook Stable and raised Czech Republic from A+ to AA-; Outlook Stable. (Newswires)
 

COMMODITIES

Baker Hughes Rig Count (3 Aug) Total rigs fell by 4 to 1044 rigs. (Newswires)


GEOPOLITICAL

Venezuela claimed there was an assassination attempt on President Maduro by far-right opponents after several drones armed with explosives blew up near President Maduro, while reports also noted Maduro was unharmed and that 7 people were being treated for injuries. (Newswires)
 

US

US President Trump stated that tariffs are working and that the US will be able to begin reducing large amounts of its USD 21tln debt due to tariffs. (Twitter)

NEC Director Kudlow said he does not want to forecast 5% GDP growth but said it is definitely a ‘plausible number’, while he also said the USD 200bln tariffs on Chinese goods are not finalised and warned China should not underestimate Trump on trade. Kudlow added China’s USD 60bln tariffs might be weak and that there has been some communication "at the highest level" between US and China, while he also noted that that there is some hint that China now wish to talk. Furthermore, Kudlow commented that an announcement with the EU will be coming up and that they will probably have positive news on Mexico with an announcement to be within 30 days. (Newswires)

Mexico's Economy Minister Guarjardo said they are ready to move into finishing up most of the issues between US and Mexico next week and is optimistic a deal can be done by the end of August. (Newswires)

US Non-Farm Payrolls Jul 157k vs. Exp. 190.0k (Prev. 213.0k, Rev. 248k); 2 month net revision +59K. (Newswires)
US Unemployment Rate Jul 3.9% vs. Exp. 3.9% (Prev. 4.0%)
US Average Earnings YY Jul 2.7% vs. Exp. 2.7% (Prev. 2.7%)
US ISM Non-Manufacturing PMI Jul 55.7 vs. Exp. 58.6 (Prev. 59.1)
US Markit Services PMI Final 56.0 (Prev. 56.2)
US Markit Comp Final PMI Jul 55.7 (Prev. 55.9)
US Goods Trade Balance (R) Jun -67.92B (Prev. -68.33B)


MARKET RECAP

In thin trade with only 500k ES traded by midday in the US, equity futures were initially boosted as the PBoC increasing its required reserve ratio back to 20% from 0%, which strengthened the CNY and hit USD across all pairs, and a boost to stocks; this was initially seen as a move to ease trade war effects between the US and China. However, the move was undone as China released its potential retaliation list of tariffs on up to $60bln of US goods. However, the moves were very limited, with ES patrolling a 10-point range in US hours. Kraft Heinz (KHC) reported its figures Friday morning which beat on both the top and bottom lines. KHC were also boosted after reports in NY Post which stated the food manufacturer was in preliminary talks with Campbell Soup (CPB), according to people familiar with the matter. The NY Post reported that KHC is looking for a bargain, and will likely not pay much of a premium for CPB. DISH (DISH) beat on both top and bottom lines, which placed it as one of the outperformers on Friday. DISH’s earnings cool gave a lift to the shares throughout the day as the co. is on track to finish its wireless network on time, and the Chairman stated they are confident its Internet of Things network will be accepted by the FCC. CBS (CBS) reported AMC on Thursday with little fireworks as EPS beat by 1c and revenues beat by $10mln. Alphabet (GOOGL) are reportedly struggling to regain entry into China due to ongoing trade tensions, and it is also being investigated by the Turkish antitrust board. During hours, WSJ reported that Australia’s Amcor is in late stage talks with Bemis (BMS) where the shares spiked 6% before resuming and extending to intraday highs of 13%. IBM (IBM) outperformed the DJI following unconfirmed source reports that Carl Icahn is building a stake in the company. SPX +0.5% at 2840, NDX +0.3% at 7395, DJI at +0.5% at 25462.

There were further reports of short-covering after traders were positioned for a better NFP headline based on the ADP data released on Wednesday, IGM said. The complex was also buoyed by a ramping up of trade tensions (this time, from the Chinese side). The net result was a slightly flatter curve, with major curve spreads little changed. US 10YR T-notes settled 9 ticks higher at 119-19+.
